title: Dividing the Expression
text: Remember, we must start by dividing the first term, $$5x^2$$, by $$x$$. This gives us $$5x$$.

title: Multiplying Expressions
text: Now, we must multiply everything in the divisor by $$5x$$ and subtract from the original polynomial. This means we subtract $$5x^2+5x$$. This cycle of "division" and "multiplication" will continue until the divident is of a lesser degree than the divisor.

title: Full Solution
text: If you're stuck, check your work with the full solution below. The answer is $$5x-2$$.\n##figure1.gif##
